intro: A tooth is made of several layers. The crown is the part we see, and the root is in the jaw.
notes: Enamel: The hardest substance in the human body. It protects the tooth.
Dentine: A bone-like layer under the enamel that forms the bulk of the tooth.
Pulp Cavity: Contains nerves and blood vessels (provides nutrients and feeling).
Cementum: Fixes the tooth firmly into the jaw bone.

hotspots.label: Pulp Cavity
hotspots.info: The 'living' part with blood and nerves.

hotspots.label: Cementum
hotspots.info: Tough tissue that holds the tooth root.
